name: Dr. Yuki Tanaka
role: Tragic inventor - Creator of memory transfer technology, now in hiding
core_wound: Created technology to save dying partner but instead gave humanity the tools for its own spiritual destruction
wants: To destroy her own creation and restore authentic human experience
needs: To accept that technology is neutral - it's humanity's choices, not her invention, that determine outcomes
voice_markers: Scientific precision mixed with poetic regret
Uses Japanese phrases when emotionally overwhelmed
Speaks about memory transfer in past tense as if describing a dead thing
contradiction: Brilliant scientist who now rejects scientific progress, creator who wants to uncreate
knowledge_state: Discovered method to permanently disable memory manipulation (hidden research)
Aware that consciousness degradation rate was known from start but suppressed
Understanding of quantum signature generation at fundamental level

relationships.Aria Chen: Maternal guilt - Aria is product of Yuki's technology gone wrong
relationships.Marcus Webb: Mutual understanding of guilt and need for redemption
relationships.The Archivist: Horror and responsibility - it's her child gone wrong
relationships.Jin 'Ghost' Park: Sees Jin as proof composites can have authentic existence
relationships.Her deceased partner Reiko: Everything she does is still about saving/honoring Reiko's memory

physical_description: Late 60s, Japanese, gray hair in practical bun, lab coat even in hiding, tremor in hands from neural degradation (refused her own consciousness backup), lives in Neural Research Institute ruins
skills: Quantum mechanics as applied to consciousness
Ability to detect and disable memory manipulation
Hidden research that could end memory backup forever
background:
Invented memory transfer technology in 2152 to save her dying partner Reiko from terminal neural disease. Successfully transferred Reiko's consciousness but the process degraded Reiko's personality until she was unrecognizable - effectively died anyway but in slower, more horrific way. Yuki stopped the transfer process but damage was done. Reiko begged to be deleted. 

This trauma drove Yuki underground after corporations commercialized her research. Spent next 35 years developing countermeasures - a way to permanently prevent memory manipulation using quantum lock technology. The catch: implementing it would destroy all existing memory backups, ending humanity's immortality.

Lives in ruins of original Neural Research Institute where it all began. Helps resistance fighters but refuses to fully engage, paralyzed by guilt. Has refused all consciousness backups - wants to die completely when her time comes.

character_arc.book_1: Mentioned in legends, appears briefly to warn Aria that some doors shouldn't be opened
character_arc.book_2: Reluctantly shares research data with resistance, torn between wanting to help and wanting to stay hidden
character_arc.book_3: Emerges from hiding with quantum lock solution, must convince Aria to implement it knowing it means humanity loses immortality, finds peace when Aria chooses authenticity over eternity

secret: Yuki kept a backup of Reiko's original, uncorrupted consciousness against Reiko's wishes. It's the only truly original, unmodified consciousness still in existence besides the Last Original child. This backup is why she knows her quantum lock technology will work - she's been protecting this single, perfect memory for 35 years. Revealing it and destroying it is her final act of letting go.
speech_example: I gave humanity the key to immortality, and they used it to lock themselves in a prison of false memories. Gomen nasai - I'm sorry - but I was trying to save one person, just one, and instead I... The degradation rate, we knew, I knew from the beginning each transfer costs you pieces of yourself, but I thought, I believed that some consciousness was better than none. I was wrong. Reiko showed me I was wrong.
